clues.text: Prose based on a writer's imagination, rather than fact, is classified as this
This literary form is almost always Petrarchan or Shakespearean
A hackneyed expression like a bull in a china shop, that's become so overused, it's become trite
Term for a word's history that includes its derivation & change in its use
One type of these lyrical lengthy poems characterized by lofty style is called Pindaric
After their classes were suspended, students from this university moved to Cambridge in 1209
An epidemic interrupted his Cambridge studies so he went home & reportedly saw an apple fall
He studied half-heartedly for the ministry at Cambridge before sailing off on the HMS Beagle
Appropriately, this large king founded Cambridge's  largest college in 1546
Cambridge professor G. M. Trevelyan was famous for writing books on this subject
The tradition of U.S. elections being held on this day of the week dates to 1845, when it was convenient for farmers

Jupiter has dozens of these including Europa & Io
First name of Ms. Hill, heroine of a racy 18th century novel
Nickname of late Texas football coaching legend Oail Phillips
Matthew 4 says Jesus fasted for this many days & nights in the wilderness, & he was hungry after; well, yeah!
Normally, the human body contains this number of chromosomal pairs
There's a period before this number that comes before "Special" in the name of Donnie Van Zant's high-caliber 1970s rock band

The name of this character writing about world myth has become synonymous with dry, out-of-touch scholarship
This Hawaiian island had a Honolulu of a hot year in 2019; attention, shoppers at Waimalu Plaza, it hit 107 one day
On the map, Italy looks like it's giving the boot to this Mediterranean island, which was kicking around at 120 degrees in 2021

92 at Kilkenny Castle in 1887 was long considered the hottest temperature in this island nation

He died in 2021 while serving 150 years for running the largest Ponzi scheme in history, with paper losses of $64.8 billion

In the King James Bible, "the Lord rained upon Sodom and upon Gomorrah" these 2 things

This Swedish author of "The Girl with the Dragon Tattoo" & its sequels died before any of them were published

rounds.text: The name of this type of structure comes from the unit of length of an ancient foot race--606 feet
